  </td>
  <td width="12%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:12.28%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">December
  2009</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:2.3%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr>
  <td width="21%" valign="top" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:21.18%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 10.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Customer service agents</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:1.3%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="11%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:11.8%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">105</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:1.3%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="48%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:48.52%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 10.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">None</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:1.32%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="12%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:12.28%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:2.3%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr>
  <td width="21%" valign="top" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:21.18%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 10.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Management /<br>
  Administrative / Clerical</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:1.3%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="11%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:11.8%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">35</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:1.3%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="48%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:48.52%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 10.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">None</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:1.32%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="12%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:12.28%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:2.3%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr>
  <td width="21%" valign="top" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:21.18%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:1.3%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="11%" valign="bottom" style="border-bottom:double windowtext 1.5pt;border-left:none;border-right:none;border-top:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:11.8%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">244</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:1.3%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="48%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:48.52%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:1.32%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="12%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:12.28%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:2.3%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Cyclicality
and Seasonality</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The airline industry generally is subject to
cyclical moves in the economy.&#160; Because
both personal discretionary travel and business travel may be expected to
decline during periods of economic weakness, the airline industry tends to
experience poorer financial results during such periods.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Mesaba&#146;s cyclicality is tied to the business
and operating decisions of Northwest.&#160;
Operations of the major airlines continue to be impacted by the rapid
growth of low cost airlines, the increasing number of businesses utilizing
teleconferencing or web-based meetings and the advent of internet travel web
sites, which enable consumers to find travel alternatives.&#160; Mesaba has historically shown greater
revenues and earnings in the first and second fiscal quarters.&#160; Northwest has historically seen increased
leisure travel during these periods on domestic and international routes, which
contributes to an increased number of flights for Mesaba.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Seasonal factors, primarily weather
conditions and passenger demand, generally affect Big Sky&#146;s monthly passenger
boardings.&#160; Big Sky has historically
shown a higher level of passenger boardings in the July through December period
as compared with the January through June period for many of the cities
served.&#160; As a result of such factors, Big
Sky&#146;s revenues and earnings have shown a corresponding increase during the July
through December period.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Recent
Developments</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">As discussed more fully in &#147;Item 8. Financial
Statements and Supplemental Data, Note 19 &#151; Subsequent Events,&#148; Holdings
unconditionally guaranteed Mesaba&#146;s obligations related to Mesaba&#146;s facility at
the Cincinnati/Northern Kentucky International Airport.&#160; In accordance with this guaranty, Holdings
has been making the required bond and lease payments on the facility since the
Petition Date.&#160; On February 15, 2006,
Holdings received notice declaring Holdings&#146; liability for all sums to be
immediately due and payable.&#160; On April
18, 2006, Holdings entered into an agreement with UMB Bank, N.A. (&#147;UMB&#148;), the
trustee for the bondholders, under which UMB agreed to forbear acceleration of
Holdings&#146; guarantee obligations in exchange for Holdings delivering a letter of
credit in the amount of $13.1 million to secure the payment of the obligations
guaranteed by Holdings to UMB.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">12</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Available
Information</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company maintains a website at
www.mairholdings.com.&#160; On its website,
free of charge, the Company makes available its Annual Report on Form 10-K and
links to the SEC website for other public filings.&#160; The company&#146;s Code of Ethics for its Chief
Executive Officer and financial officers is also available on its website.&#160; All information is also available in print
upon written request to the Company&#146;s General Counsel at 150 South Fifth
Street, Suite 1360, Minneapolis, Minnesota 55402.&#160; The Company is not including the information
contained on or available through its website as a part of, or incorporating
such information by reference into, this Annual Report on Form 10-K.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<h2 style="font-style:italic;margin:12.0pt 0in 3.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:normal;">Item
1A.&#160; RISK FACTORS</font></i></b><a name="Item1a_RiskFactors_100950"></a></h2>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company&#146;s operations and financial
results are subject to various risks and uncertainties, some of which are
described below.&#160; The Company could also
be adversely affected by additional risks and uncertainties not presently known
or believed to be material.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Risks
Related to Mesaba&#146;s Bankruptcy</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Mesaba&#146;s
operation during bankruptcy and its emergence from bankruptcy will require
interaction with its Creditors&#146; Committee.</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The United States Trustee for the District of
Minnesota has appointed a Creditors&#146; Committee in Mesaba&#146;s bankruptcy
case.&#160; The Creditors&#146; Committee and its
legal representatives have a right to be heard on all matters that come before
the Bankruptcy Court concerning Mesaba&#146;s reorganization.&#160; There can be no assurance that the Creditors&#146;
Committee will support Mesaba&#146;s positions or its plan of reorganization, and
any disagreements between the Creditors&#146; Committee and Mesaba could protract
the Chapter 11 process, hinder Mesaba&#146;s ability to operate during the Chapter
11 process and delay Mesaba&#146;s emergence from Chapter 11.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">If
Mesaba is unable to obtain debtor-in-possession financing, it may be unable to
emerge from bankruptcy.</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">When Mesaba filed for Chapter 11 bankruptcy
protection, Holdings provided a commitment to provide a certain level of
debtor-in-possession financing.&#160; Holdings&#146;
commitment to provide such financing expired on March 24, 2006.&#160; Mesaba is actively seeking financing from
other sources, but there can be no assurance that Mesaba will be able to obtain
such financing.&#160; If Mesaba is unable to
obtain adequate debtor-in-possession financing by the end of the second quarter
of fiscal 2007, Mesaba could run out of cash and be forced to convert to a
Chapter 7 bankruptcy liquidation.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">If
Mesaba is unable to confirm a reorganization plan, it may be unable to emerge
from bankruptcy.</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In order for Mesaba to emerge from
bankruptcy, the Bankruptcy Court must approve a reorganization plan for
Mesaba.&#160; The reorganization plan will be
subject to a vote by certain classes of creditors, including Mesaba&#146;s secured
creditors and unsecured creditors.&#160; The
Bankruptcy Court will generally not approve a reorganization plan unless all
impaired classes of creditors vote to accept the plan; however, Mesaba may
elect to invoke certain provisions of the Bankruptcy Code in order to obtain
confirmation of the plan over the vote of a dissenting class of creditors.&#160; In addition to the voting requirements for
confirmation, Mesaba will have to satisfy other provisions of the Bankruptcy
Code in order to confirm its reorganization plan, including showing that the
plan is feasible.&#160; If Mesaba is unable to
meet these confirmation requirements, it may be unable to emerge from
bankruptcy.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">13</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='13',FILE='C:\JMS\eudelhofen\06-9742-1\task1193764\9742-1-ba-01.htm',USER='eudelho',CD='Jun 27 14:35 2006' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">If
Holdings is unable to find an alternate sublessee for Mesaba&#146;s
Cincinnati/Northern Kentucky Airport facility, Holdings may be required to
accrue an additional $8.2 million of expense related to the bonds associated
with the initial financing of the facility.</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Mesaba currently leases a facility at the
Cincinnati/Northern Kentucky International Airport, but vacated the facility
and ceased making the required lease payments on it in November 2005.&#160; Holdings unconditionally guaranteed full and
prompt payment of the ground lease and the bonds associated with the initial
financing of the facility.&#160; In accordance
with this guaranty, Holdings has made the required bond and ground lease
payments due since November 2005.&#160; In
April 2006, in exchange for the bondholders forbearing acceleration of the
bonds, Holdings delivered a letter of credit to the bondholders to assure
payment of the bonds.&#160; As of December 31,
2005, Holdings recorded a $4.8 million liability with respect to the lease and
guaranty, which assumed that the facility would remain vacant for the next two
years, during which time Holdings would continue to make the bond and lease
payments, and that thereafter Holdings would be able to sublease the facility
at a 20% discount.&#160; If Holdings is unable
to find an alternate sublessee for the facility, Holdings may be required to
record an additional liability of up to $8.2 million.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Any
court-approved reorganization by Mesaba could result in Holdings losing all or
a portion of its equity in Mesaba</font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In general, the absolute priority rule in the
Bankruptcy Code requires that all of the debtor&#146;s creditors must be paid in
full; otherwise the equity holders in the debtor are not entitled to retain
their equity interests, unless certain exceptions to the absolute priority rule
are met.&#160; It will likely be some time
before Mesaba proposes a reorganization plan.&#160;
However, the outcome of any vote on Mesaba&#146;s reorganization plan, as
well as the terms and conditions of the plan itself, will determine whether
Holdings risks losing some or all of its ownership in Mesaba due to the
application of the absolute priority rule.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Mesaba
may need exit financing to emerge from bankruptcy, and there is no assurance
Mesaba can obtain exit financing.</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The terms of any debtor-in-possession
financing provided to Mesaba will likely require such financing to be repaid
upon Mesaba&#146;s exit from bankruptcy.&#160;
Accordingly, Mesaba will need to provide for the repayment of any
debtor-in-possession financing through a source of exit financing or through
some other means.&#160; There is no assurance
that such exit financing will be available to Mesaba upon its exit from
bankruptcy or that Mesaba will have the means to repay any debtor-in-possession
financing without exit financing.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Part of
Mesaba&#146;s bankruptcy strategy is to achieve labor cost savings, the threat of
which could cause slowdowns or other labor unrest by Mesaba&#146;s labor unions.</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Since November 2005, Mesaba has been engaged
in negotiations with all of its unions to address the need for contracts that
are consistent with changing company and industry conditions.&#160; To that end, Mesaba filed a motion with the
Bankruptcy Court requesting authorization to reject all of its CBAs.&#160; On January 31, 2006, the Bankruptcy Court
approved the tentative agreement reached between Mesaba and the TWU.&#160; The Bankruptcy Court heard testimony from
Mesaba and the remaining three unions for Mesaba&#146;s pilots, mechanics and flight
attendants in February and March 2006.&#160;
On May 18, 2006, the Bankruptcy Court denied Mesaba&#146;s motion to
reject.&#160; Although the Bankruptcy Court
agreed with Mesaba&#146;s core business assumptions, the court ruled that Mesaba
failed to satisfy certain technical elements required to authorize rejection of
the labor contracts.&#160; The Bankruptcy
Court stated that if Mesaba chooses to remedy the defects in its original
motion, the court would hear a renewed motion in a prompt manner.&#160; On June 12, </font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">14</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='14',FILE='C:\JMS\eudelhofen\06-9742-1\task1193764\9742-1-ba-01.htm',USER='eudelho',CD='Jun 27 14:35 2006' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">2006, Mesaba filed a renewed motion for
authority to reject its CBAs, and the Bankruptcy Court began hearing the motion
on June 26, 2006.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">While Mesaba remains committed to reaching
negotiated agreements with these unions, there is no guarantee that Mesaba will
be able to do so or that it will be able to do so in accordance with Mesaba&#146;s
planned timeframe for implementing labor cost savings.&#160; Furthermore, it is possible that members of
these unions will participate in work slowdowns or other labor unrest to
protest Mesaba&#146;s requested new contract terms.&#160;
In addition, Mesaba has experienced an increase in non-union employee
turnover.&#160; If the high attrition rate
continues, Mesaba could experience operating disruptions.&#160; Any labor unrest and any additional delay in
achieving labor cost savings will result in a material adverse effect on Mesaba&#146;s
financial condition and results of operations.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">If, in
the process of performing its duties, Mesaba&#146;s Creditors&#146; Committee believes
any claims exist regarding Mesaba&#146;s relationship with Holdings, the Creditors&#146;
Committee could assert such claims against Holdings.</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Certain provisions of the Bankruptcy Code
allow a debtor-in-possession to recover transfers of cash or other property
that were made prior to the debtor&#146;s bankruptcy filing.&#160; As a result, one of the traditional duties of
an official committee of unsecured creditors appointed in a bankruptcy case is
to examine transactions between a debtor-in-possession and its affiliates.&#160; In Mesaba&#146;s bankruptcy case, the Creditors&#146;
Committee has requested the right to review various documents concerning
transactions between Holdings and Mesaba, including the payment of dividends
from Mesaba to Holdings, and to take depositions in order to understand these
transactions.&#160; Holdings believes all
dividends paid by Mesaba were appropriate and in compliance with the
requirements of the Minnesota Business Corporation Act.&#160; However, in order to address any questions
about the relationship between Holdings and Mesaba, Holdings has entered into
an agreed protective order with the Creditors&#146; Committee to voluntarily provide
documents explaining the relationship between Holdings and Mesaba and to
provide witness testimony concerning the documents provided.&#160; The Creditors&#146; Committee has not completed
its review of the transactions between Holdings and Mesaba and, consequently,
the Creditors&#146; Committee has not yet advised Holdings of any specific claims
arising from its review.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Mesaba has experienced a high
attrition rate in its accounting, finance and information technology
departments, and if Mesaba is unable to replace individuals in these areas,
Mesaba&#146;s internal control over financial reporting may be adversely affected.</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Since Mesaba filed for bankruptcy protection
on October 13, 2005, Mesaba has experienced resignations of key personnel in
the accounting and SEC reporting functions as well as the information
technology area, which provides technical support to the finance department.&#160; Additionally, Mesaba has begun to implement
company-wide staff reductions and a reorganization of its operations.&#160; Mesaba has added contract workers and
consultants as temporary replacements of the key personnel who have resigned,
and Mesaba expects that it will be able to continue to engage consultants and
other temporary replacements for these positions in the near future.&#160; However, if Mesaba is not able to
successfully attract qualified permanent employees to fill these key positions,
Mesaba&#146;s internal control over financial reporting could be adversely affected.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">15</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='15',FILE='C:\JMS\eudelhofen\06-9742-1\task1193764\9742-1-ba-01.htm',USER='eudelho',CD='Jun 27 14:35 2006' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Risks
Related to Mesaba&#146;s Relationship with Northwest</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Mesaba
is dependent on its relationship with Northwest as its major customer, and the
loss of this relationship would substantially harm the Company&#146;s financial
results.</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">During fiscal 2006, Northwest accounted for
94.5% of Mesaba&#146;s operating revenues.&#160;
Additionally, Mesaba consistently carries a receivable due from
Northwest between $12 million to $16 million that is not collateralized.&#160; Due to Northwest&#146;s missed payments prior to
and following its bankruptcy filing, Mesaba recorded a reserve of the
receivable due from Northwest, net of certain offsetting liabilities, through
September 13, 2005, the date of Northwest&#146;s bankruptcy filing.&#160; Mesaba&#146;s future success will depend upon
Northwest&#146;s ability to successfully restructure through bankruptcy.&#160; Further, Northwest&#146;s bankruptcy has
effectively placed Mesaba&#146;s contracts with Northwest at risk, as Northwest has
the option to assume or reject or renegotiate each of such contracts in
connection with its bankruptcy proceedings.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Mesaba is currently continuing to operate
flights for Northwest, but the exact nature of Mesaba&#146;s future relationship
with Northwest may not be known until such time as Northwest adopts its
bankruptcy reorganization plan.&#160; As of
June 8, 2006, Northwest had removed 13 Saabs and 19 Avros from Mesaba&#146;s
fleet.&#160; In January 2006, Northwest
advised Mesaba that the remaining Avros operated by Mesaba will be removed by
the end of December 2006.&#160; Northwest also
advised Mesaba that it will remove one of the CRJs that Mesaba currently
operates and place the CRJ with Northwest&#146;s newly formed subsidiary,
Compass.&#160; Finally, as part of its
reorganization, Northwest has requested bids from regional airlines for the
operation of up to 126 CRJs, 124 of which are currently operated by Pinnacle,
and two of which are currently operated by Mesaba.&#160; If Mesaba is not awarded some or all of the
CRJ business, Northwest will remove the remaining CRJ from Mesaba&#146;s fleet.&#160; If Northwest rejects the ASA or negotiates a
new ASA (and such renegotiation does not include a waiver by Mesaba of its
claims against Northwest), the prepetition amounts owed to Mesaba by Northwest
would remain an unsecured claim, and Mesaba would likely receive only a small
percentage of the amounts owed to it, and even then would only receive such
amounts after a plan of reorganization is approved by Northwest&#146;s bankruptcy
court.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Northwest
has not guaranteed that it will grow Mesaba&#146;s regional fleet, and Northwest
could opt to operate new regional aircraft with its own new subsidiary or
utilize other regional airlines.</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The ASA does not prohibit Northwest from
contracting with other regional airlines to provide the same services that
Mesaba currently provides.&#160; Northwest
currently has an airline services agreement with Pinnacle, and Pinnacle serves
many of the same cities as Mesaba.&#160; Northwest
has issued a request for proposal for the operation of up to 126 CRJs (the
total number of CRJs currently operated by Mesaba and Pinnacle combined), and
Northwest has also formed a new subsidiary, Compass, that could ultimately
operate regional aircraft.&#160; Accordingly,
Northwest could choose to expand its agreement with Pinnacle in competition
with Mesaba or to contract with other regional airlines or to replace one or
both of its current regional airline partners with Compass.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Risks
Related to the Company&#146;s Business and Operation</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Mesaba&#146;s
and Big Sky&#146;s success is dependent on their ability to obtain all necessary
aircraft, engines, parts and related maintenance and support from various
aircraft manufacturers and vendors.</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Mesaba and Big Sky are dependent on various
aircraft manufacturers and other vendors to provide sufficient parts and
related maintenance and support services on a timely basis.&#160; Additionally, Mesaba and Big Sky rely on
various engine manufacturers for parts, repair and overhaul services and other
types of support services.&#160; Mesaba&#146;s
bankruptcy and nonpayment for prepetition goods and services has adversely
affected its relationship with certain vendors.&#160;
The failure of aircraft or engine manufacturers and other </font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">16</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='16',FILE='C:\JMS\eudelhofen\06-9742-1\task1193764\9742-1-ba-01.htm',USER='eudelho',CD='Jun 27 14:35 2006' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">vendors to provide parts or related services
on a timely, cost-effective basis could materially and adversely affect Mesaba&#146;s
or Big Sky&#146;s business, financial condition and results of operations.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Because
Mesaba is unable to pass along increased operating costs, Mesaba&#146;s earnings
will be negatively affected as its fleet continues to age.</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">As Mesaba&#146;s fleet of aircraft age, the cost
of maintaining the aircraft will likely increase.&#160; Because many aircraft components are required
to be replaced after a specified time, numbers of flight hours or take-off and
landing cycles, and because new aviation technology may require certain parts
to be retrofitted, the cost to maintain aging aircraft will generally exceed
the cost to maintain newer aircraft.&#160; Any
material increase in such costs will have a material adverse effect on Mesaba&#146;s
business, financial condition and results of operations.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">If
Mesaba loses certain of its ground handling business, Mesaba&#146;s results of
operations could be materially affected.</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Mesaba performs various ground handling
services for Northwest, Pinnacle and other airlines at Minneapolis, Detroit and
certain other airport locations.&#160; The
ground handling business is highly competitive, and airlines are constantly
reviewing their cost structures to locate the most cost-effective ground handling
providers.&#160; Mesaba receives the majority
of its ground handling revenue from Northwest and Pinnacle, and Mesaba does not
have any long-term agreements with either airline.&#160; If Northwest or Pinnacle terminates Mesaba&#146;s
ground handling services, Mesaba&#146;s financial results would be materially
affected, both through a loss of revenue and increased transition expenses.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Mesaba
and Big Sky could incur significant costs if they experience difficulty
finding, training and retaining employees.</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Mesaba&#146;s and Big Sky&#146;s businesses are
labor-intensive and require large numbers of pilots, flight attendants,
maintenance technicians and other personnel.&#160;
The airline industry has from time to time experienced a shortage of
qualified personnel, specifically pilots and maintenance technicians.&#160; In addition, as is common with most airline
competitors, Mesaba and Big Sky have faced turnover of their employees.&#160; For example, Mesaba&#146;s and Big Sky&#146;s pilots
and maintenance technicians, as well as Mesaba&#146;s flight attendants, occasionally
leave to work for larger airlines which generally offer higher salaries and
more extensive benefit programs than regional airlines are financially able to
offer.&#160; In the event of a significant
increase in the turnover of employees in the above-mentioned positions, Mesaba
and Big Sky would incur significantly higher training costs than would
otherwise be necessary.&#160; Mesaba and Big
Sky cannot provide assurance that they will be able to recruit, train and
retain the qualified employees they require to carry out their business plans.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Mesaba
and Big Sky could be adversely affected by the highly competitive nature of the
airline industry.</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The airline industry is highly competitive,
and Northwest competes not only with other regional carriers, but also with
low-cost airlines and major airlines on many of its routes, including the
routes that Mesaba flies.&#160; Some of these
competitors are significantly larger and possess greater resources than
Northwest.&#160; Moreover, any new entry in
the markets Mesaba serves could lessen the economic benefits Northwest derives
from servicing these markets.&#160; Finally,
Big Sky also competes with low-cost and regional carriers on its routes, and it
faces the same competitive challenges described above.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">17</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='17',FILE='C:\JMS\eudelhofen\06-9742-1\task1193764\9742-1-ba-01.htm',USER='eudelho',CD='Jun 27 14:35 2006' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Holdings&#146; ability to diversify within the airline industry
may be limited by the terms of its side letter agreement with Mesaba&#146;s pilots&#146;
union.</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In January 2004, Holdings entered into a
letter agreement with ALPA, Mesaba&#146;s pilots&#146; union, that may limit the types of
aircraft Big Sky may fly and may place additional requirements on Holdings if
it forms or acquires any other airline subsidiary.&nbsp; These possible
limitations were included in Mesaba&#146;s negotiations with its pilots in Mesaba&#146;s
bankruptcy proceedings, and the Bankruptcy Court ruled that Mesaba cannot
reject the letter agreement.&nbsp; In light of this ruling, Holdings is
currently assessing its alternatives with respect to the letter agreement.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Mesaba&#146;s
and Big Sky&#146;s compliance with various regulations governing the airline
industry can be costly, and Mesaba and Big Sky could be harmed if they fail to
comply with such regulations.</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Airlines are subject to extensive regulatory
and legal requirements that involve significant compliance costs that can
result in increased costs for passengers and the airline.&#160; The FAA, DOT and Transportation Security
Administration periodically propose additional laws, regulations, taxes and
airport rates and charges.&#160; Such measures
could have the effect of raising ticket prices, reducing revenue, increasing
costs or reducing demand for air travel.&#160;
Mesaba and Big Sky expect to continue incurring expenses to comply with
existing and future regulations.&#160;
Moreover, if either Mesaba or Big Sky fails to comply with applicable
regulations, they may be subject to sanctions, including the following:</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">warning
letters;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">fines;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">injunctions;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">orders relating
to grounding of aircraft, inspection of aircraft, installation of new
safety-related items and removal and replacement of certain aircraft parts; or</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">criminal
prosecutions.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Future
terrorists attacks, other world events, general economic conditions and other
factors beyond the Company&#146;s control could substantially harm the Company.</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The terrorist attacks of September 11, 2001
and the prolonged unrest in the Middle East materially affected and continue to
affect the airline industry.&#160; Concerns
about further terrorist attacks have had a negative impact on air travel demand.&#160; In addition, security procedures introduced
at airports since the attacks have increased the inconvenience of air travel,
both in reality and in customer perception, leading to further reduction in
demand.&#160; Finally, the continued rise in
jet fuel prices has had an adverse economic effect on all airlines, including
Northwest and Big Sky.&#160; Additional
terrorist attacks, the fear of such attacks, continued conflict in Iraq,
Afghanistan or other countries or continued increases in fuel prices could
further affect the airline industry and could cause general instability in
financial markets.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Because a substantial portion of air travel,
including business travel, is discretionary, the industry tends to experience
adverse financial results during general economic downturns.&#160; Soft economic conditions continue to put
pressure on the profitability of the industry.&#160;
Any general decline in passenger traffic may harm the Company&#146;s
business.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Mesaba&#146;s and Big Sky&#146;s operations are also
subject to delays caused by factors beyond their control, including air traffic
congestion at airports, adverse weather conditions and increased security
measures.&#160; Such delays frustrate
passengers, reduce aircraft utilization and increase costs, all of which may
affect profitability and harm the Company&#146;s financial condition and results of
operations.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">18</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='18',FILE='C:\JMS\eudelhofen\06-9742-1\task1193764\9742-1-ba-01.htm',USER='eudelho',CD='Jun 27 14:35 2006' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Mesaba
and Big Sky are increasingly dependent upon technology in their operations, and
any failure of such technology could adversely affect them.</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Mesaba and Big Sky have made substantial
investments in technology to manage their operations.&#160; In particular, the systems operations control
centers, which oversee daily flight operations, are dependent on a number of
technology systems to operate effectively.&#160;
These technology systems may be vulnerable to various sources of
interruption due to events beyond Mesaba&#146;s or Big Sky&#146;s control, including
natural disasters, terrorist attacks, computer viruses and hackers.&#160; In addition, large-scale interruption in
technology on which Mesaba and Big Sky depend, such as power,
telecommunications or the Internet, could substantially disrupt their
operations.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Any
airline accident in which Mesaba or Big Sky is involved could subject Mesaba or
Big Sky to substantial liability and seriously harm the Company&#146;s financial
condition and results of operations.</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">An accident involving Mesaba or Big Sky
aircraft could result in injuries and loss of life and, therefore, result in
significant claims from injured persons and surviving relatives.&#160; An accident could also result in substantial
property damage, loss of aircraft from service and adverse publicity for the
affected airline.&#160; The DOT requires
airlines to carry liability insurance.&#160;
Although Mesaba and Big Sky believe their liability insurance is in amounts
and of the type generally consistent with industry practice, substantial claims
resulting from an accident in excess of insurance coverage would harm the
Company&#146;s business and financial results.&#160;
Any resulting claims would also be costly to defend and could harm
Mesaba&#146;s or Big Sky&#146;s reputation.&#160;
Moreover, any aircraft accident, even if fully insured or not directly
involving Mesaba or Big Sky, could cause a public perception that flying is
less safe or reliable than other transportation alternatives, which could harm
the Company&#146;s financial condition and results of operations.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Risks
Related to the Company&#146;s Stock</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Together,
certain of the Company&#146;s shareholders own or have the right to acquire a
significant portion of the Company&#146;s stock and could ultimately control
decisions regarding the Company.</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Northwest owns 27.5% of the Company&#146;s common
stock.&#160; Pursuant to its Warrant,
Northwest also has the right to purchase an aggregate of 4,112,500 shares of
the Company&#146;s common stock, subject to certain vesting restrictions related to
the future delivery by Northwest of CRJ aircraft.&#160; It is possible that if Mesaba is awarded
additional CRJ aircraft by Northwest, Mesaba and Northwest may negotiate a new
airline services agreement, and the Company and Northwest may then also
renegotiate the terms of any warrant that may be issued.&#160; Additionally, several other shareholders also
own significant blocks of the Company&#146;s common stock.&#160; Because the parties described above currently
own a large portion of the Company&#146;s stock, they may be able to determine or
significantly influence the outcome of corporate actions requiring shareholder
approval, including decisions as to the Company&#146;s direction and policies;
future issuances of securities, incurrence of debt, amendments to the Company&#146;s
articles of incorporation and bylaws, payment of dividends on the Company&#146;s
common stock; and acquisitions, sales of the Company&#146;s assets, mergers or
similar transactions, including transactions involving a change of
control.&#160; As a result, some investors may
be unwilling to purchase the Company&#146;s common stock.&#160; In addition, if the demand for the Company&#146;s
common stock is reduced because of these shareholders&#146; control of the Company,
the price of the Company&#146;s common stock could be materially depressed.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Future
sales of the Company&#146;s common stock by its shareholders could depress the price
of the Company&#146;s stock.</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Sales of a large number of shares of the
Company&#146;s common stock or the availability of a large number of shares for sale
could adversely affect the market price of the Company&#146;s common stock.&#160; As of March 31, </font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">19</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='19',FILE='C:\JMS\eudelhofen\06-9742-1\task1193764\9742-1-ba-01.htm',USER='eudelho',CD='Jun 27 14:35 2006' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">2006, the Company had 20,591,840 shares of
common stock outstanding.&#160; Several of the
Company&#146;s shareholders own substantial blocks of the Company&#146;s common
stock.&#160; Additionally, along with the
shares of stock it currently owns, Northwest could own an additional large
block of the Company&#146;s common stock upon exercise of its Warrant.&#160; In connection with the ASA, the Company entered
into a registration rights agreement to register the shares of stock owned by
Northwest (including those shares underlying the Warrant).&#160; Prior to entering the ASA, Northwest had
pledged certain of these shares to Boeing Capital Corporation (&#147;Boeing&#148;), and
Boeing is also a party to the registration rights agreement.&#160; The registration statement has not been
filed, and will likely not be filed until a final resolution is reached with
respect to the ASA, unless Boeing obtains relief from the automatic stay and is
allowed to foreclose on Northwest&#146;s stock pledge and subsequently demand
registration.&#160; Nevertheless, following
any registration, future sales of those shares, or future sales of other large
blocks of the Company&#146;s common stock that are already registered, could
substantially depress the Company&#146;s stock price.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Any
future exercise of the Warrant held by Northwest could substantially dilute the
Company&#146;s common stock.</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">As of March 31, 2006, Northwest held a
Warrant exercisable for an aggregate of 4,112,500 shares of the Company&#146;s
common stock at an exercise price of $8.74 per share.&#160; To date, the Warrant has not vested, and it
will not begin to vest until Northwest delivers a total of 15 CRJs to
Mesaba.&#160; In such event, the Company and
Northwest may also renegotiate the terms of the Warrant.&#160; If and when the Warrant does vest, holders of
the Company&#146;s common stock could experience substantial ownership dilution if
Northwest elects to exercise the Warrant.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">The
Company&#146;s stock price may continue to be volatile.</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In the past two fiscal years, the market
price of the Company&#146;s common stock has ranged from a low of $4.50 per share to
a high of $10.23 per share.&#160; Because the
Company&#146;s stock is thinly traded, its market price is sensitive and may
continue to experience substantial fluctuations due to a variety of factors,
including the following:</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">failure of the
Company&#146;s operating results to meet analysts&#146; or investors&#146; expectations in any
quarter;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">securities
analysts&#146; estimates;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">material
announcements by the Company, Northwest or the Company&#146;s, Mesaba&#146;s or Big Sky&#146;s
competitors;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">public sales of
a substantial number of shares of the Company&#146;s common stock;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">increased short
sales due to the uncertainty surrounding Mesaba&#146;s bankruptcy, as well as any
purchase to cover short positions;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">regulatory
actions; or</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">general market
conditions.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Anti-takeover
provisions of the Company&#146;s articles of incorporation and bylaws and of
Minnesota law could discourage, delay or prevent a change in control.</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company&#146;s articles of incorporation and
bylaws, along with Minnesota law, could discourage, delay or prevent persons
from acquiring or attempting to acquire the Company.&#160; The Company&#146;s articles of incorporation
authorize the board of directors, without action by the Company&#146;s shareholders,
to designate and issue preferred stock in one or more series, with such rights,
preferences and privileges as the board of directors shall determine.&#160; The Company&#146;s articles of incorporation and
bylaws also mandate a classified board of directors, which makes changing
control of the board more difficult.&#160; The</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">20</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='20',FILE='C:\JMS\eudelhofen\06-9742-1\task1193764\9742-1-ba-01.htm',USER='eudelho',CD='Jun 27 14:35 2006' -->



<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">

<div>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Company&#146;s bylaws grant the board of directors
the authority to adopt, amend or repeal all or any of such bylaws, subject to
the power of the shareholders to change or repeal such bylaws.&#160; The Company&#146;s bylaws also limit who may call
meetings of the Company&#146;s shareholders.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">As a public corporation, the Company is
prohibited by the Minnesota Business Corporation Act, except under certain
specified circumstances, from engaging in any merger, significant sale of stock
or assets or business combination with any shareholder or group of shareholders
who own at least 10% of the Company&#146;s common stock.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<h2 style="font-style:italic;margin:12.0pt 0in 3.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:normal;">Item
1B.&#160; UNRESOLVED STAFF COMMENTS</font></i></b><a name="Item1b_UnresolvedStaffComments_101045"></a></h2>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">None.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<h2 style="font-style:italic;margin:12.0pt 0in 3.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:normal;">Item
2.&#160; PROPERTIES</font></i></b><a name="Item2_Properties_101050"></a></h2>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Aircraft</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Mesaba</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The following table sets forth certain
information as to Mesaba&#146;s passenger aircraft fleet as of March 31, 2006:</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:2.26%;">

  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr>
  <td width="18%" valign="top" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;border:none;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:18.52%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Avro RJ85</font></p>
  </td>

  <td width="18%" valign="top" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:18.52%;">

  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:2.62%;">

  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

  <td width="18%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:18.52%;">

  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:2.26%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
