</table>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Mesaba leases or subleases its Avro aircraft
from Northwest under operating leases with initial terms of up to ten
years.&#160; The lease and sublease agreements
for the Avros with Northwest contain certain requirements of Mesaba regarding
the payment of taxes on the aircraft, acceptable use of the aircraft, the level
of insurance to be maintained, the maintenance procedures to be performed and
the condition of the aircraft upon their return to Northwest.&#160; The ASA allows Mesaba to return Avros to
Northwest upon the occurrence of certain events, including termination of the
ASA.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Shortly after Northwest filed for bankruptcy,
it unilaterally, and in breach of the ASA, removed 12 Avros from Mesaba&#146;s
flight schedule.&#160; Mesaba and Northwest
then entered into a written agreement under which Northwest acknowledged that
Mesaba was not required to make sublease payments on the idled aircraft.&#160; That agreement expired in February 2006.&#160; Mesaba chose to wait to reject the subleases
until it was confident that Northwest would not return the idled aircraft to
the flight schedule.&#160; Mesaba discontinued
recording rent expense of approximately $7.4 million on these Avros through
March 31, 2006 when they were idled at the request of Northwest.&#160; In May 2006, Northwest formally rejected its
leases for these 12 idled Avros.&#160; To
ensure that Northwest&#146;s actions have relieved Mesaba of all liability or
obligations arising under the subleases, on June 13, 2006, Mesaba filed a
motion with the Bankruptcy Court to seek formal approval of Mesaba&#146;s rejection
of the subleases for the 12 idled aircraft.&#160;
Mesaba believes that under Section 503(b)(1) of the Bankruptcy Code,
which governs administrative claims, Northwest would have no standing to assert
an administrative claim against Mesaba for the aircraft rent because Northwest </font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">21</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='21',FILE='C:\JMS\eudelhofen\06-9742-1\task1193661\9742-1-ba-03.htm',USER='eudelho',CD='Jun 27 14:18 2006' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">had previously agreed that Mesaba had no
obligation to pay rent for grounded aircraft and because Mesaba parked and
protected the aircraft at Northwest&#146;s request.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Mesaba leases its Saab aircraft either
directly from leasing companies on a month-to-month basis or through subleases
with Northwest under operating leases with initial terms of up to 17
years.&#160; The lease and sublease agreements
with the aircraft leasing companies and Northwest contain certain requirements
of Mesaba regarding the payment of taxes on the aircraft, acceptable use of the
aircraft, the level of insurance to be maintained, the maintenance procedures
to be performed and the condition of the aircraft upon their return.&#160; The ASA allows Mesaba to return Saab aircraft
to Northwest upon the occurrence of certain events, including termination of
the ASA.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Mesaba subleases its two CRJs from Northwest
under operating leases with initial terms of up to ten years.&#160; The lease agreements contain certain
requirements of Mesaba regarding the payment of taxes on the aircraft,
acceptable use of the aircraft, the level of insurance to be maintained, the maintenance
procedures to be performed and the condition of the aircraft upon their return
to Northwest.&#160; Northwest reimburses
Mesaba&#146;s aircraft rental expense in full under the ASA.&#160; The ASA allows Mesaba to return CRJ aircraft
to Northwest upon the occurrence of certain events, including termination of
the ASA.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">As of March 31, 2006, Mesaba&#146;s existing fleet
of Avro, Saab and CRJ aircraft had remaining lease terms of up to nine
years.&#160; The current aggregate monthly
lease payments for all Mesaba aircraft is approximately $7.0 million.&#160; See further discussion in Item 7.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Big Sky</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The following table sets forth certain
information as to Big Sky&#146;s passenger aircraft fleet as of March 31, 2006.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:2.62%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="14%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:14.18%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:2.28%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="18%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:18.52%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:2.28%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="18%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:18.52%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:2.28%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="18%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:18.52%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:2.26%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr>
  <td width="18%" valign="top" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:18.52%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Metro III</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:2.62%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="14%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:14.18%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">4</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:2.28%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="18%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:18.52%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:2.28%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="18%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:18.52%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:2.28%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="18%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:18.52%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:2.26%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In January 2005, Big Sky entered into a
letter of intent to lease ten Beechcraft 1900D aircraft from Mesa Airlines,
Inc. (&#147;Mesa&#148;) to transition from its Metro fleet.&#160; During March 2005, Big Sky parked four
Metros, took delivery of five Beechcraft aircraft and began flying them.&#160; Big Sky took delivery of the remaining five
Beechcraft aircraft during fiscal 2006, and the remaining Metro fleet was
removed from service.&#160; Big Sky continues
to dispose of the Metro aircraft through subleases or other means.&#160; As of May 31, 2006, Big Sky has three Metro
aircraft that are idled and pending disposition.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Big Sky leases its Metro aircraft from
AirLift Inc. and its Beechcraft aircraft from Mesa.&#160; The lease agreements contain certain
requirements of Big Sky regarding the payment of taxes on the aircraft,
acceptable use of the aircraft, the level of insurance to be maintained, the
maintenance procedures to be performed and the condition of the aircraft upon
their return.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">As of March 31, 2006, Big Sky&#146;s fleet of
Metro and Beechcraft aircraft had remaining lease terms of 17 to 56 months and
aggregate monthly lease payments of approximately $0.2 million.&#160; The current aggregate monthly lease payments
for the nonoperating aircraft alone are approximately $0.1 million.&#160; As </font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">22</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='22',FILE='C:\JMS\eudelhofen\06-9742-1\task1193661\9742-1-ba-03.htm',USER='eudelho',CD='Jun 27 14:18 2006' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">of March 31, 2006, the Company expensed
approximately $0.8 million related to the remaining lease payments on the
nonoperating aircraft and other estimated net costs of the aircrafts&#146; return to
the lessor.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Facilities</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Holdings</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Holdings&#146; executive offices are located in
downtown Minneapolis, Minnesota.&#160;
Holdings leases approximately 3,370 square feet of office space with
lease payments of approximately $6,000 per month.&#160; The lease expires on September 30, 2010 but
contains an early termination provision allowing the lease to be cancelled on
September 30, 2007.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Mesaba</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Mesaba leases an aircraft hangar facility
from the Metropolitan Airports Commission.&#160;
Under this 25-year agreement, Mesaba leases approximately 366,000 square
feet of maintenance facilities, maintenance offices, ramp, parking and
unimproved land, of which approximately 87,000 square feet is for the
maintenance hangar facility.&#160; The lease
payments of approximately $111,000 per month commenced in October 2003.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Mesaba has a ten-year lease agreement for
approximately 33,000 square feet of office space for its principal executive
offices located in Eagan, Minnesota.&#160; The
lease payments of approximately $35,000 per month commenced in January
2004.&#160; The lease expires on December 31,
2013 but contains an early termination provision allowing the lease to be cancelled
at the end of seven years.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Mesaba subleases approximately 21,000 square
feet of office and training support space at the Pan-Am International Flight
Academy in Eagan, Minnesota for its flight operations training center.&#160; Mesaba pays approximately $27,000 per month
under the terms of this sublease, which has a term of 15 years and expires in
January 2017.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In 1999, Mesaba entered into ground and
facilities leases for approximately 497,000 square feet of facilities, ramp,
parking and unimproved land at the Cincinnati/Northern Kentucky International
Airport.&#160; The facilities lease covers
approximately 126,000 square feet of hangar and maintenance space, and Mesaba
is obligated to pay monthly rentals of approximately $92,000 until July 1, 2029
as part of a special facilities bond financing provided by the
Cincinnati/Northern Kentucky Airport Authority.&#160;
The ground lease has a 30-year term concurrent with the facilities lease
and requires payments of approximately $12,000 per month.&#160; Holdings has unconditionally guaranteed
Mesaba&#146;s obligations related to the facility.&#160;
Following its bankruptcy filing, Mesaba vacated the facility.&#160; In accordance with its guaranty, Holdings has
been making the monthly ground and facilities lease payments.&#160; Additionally, on February 15, 2006, Holdings
received notice that the trustee for the bondholders declared Holdings&#146;
guarantee for all sums to be immediately due and payable.&#160; On April 18, 2006, Holdings entered into an
agreement with UMB, the trustee for the bondholders, under which UMB agreed to
forbear acceleration of Holdings&#146; guarantee obligations in exchange for
Holdings delivering a letter of credit in the amount of $13.1 million to secure
the payment of the obligations owed by Holdings to UMB.&#160; See &#147;Item 8. Financial Statements and
Supplemental Data, Note 19 &#151; Subsequent Events&#148; for more information.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Mesaba leases approximately 334,000 square
feet of ramp, parking and unimproved land at the Detroit Metropolitan
Airport.&#160; The hangar facility of
approximately 60,000 square feet located on the property was paid in full in
fiscal 2003.&#160; The ground lease has a
20-year term with monthly lease payments of approximately $10,000.&#160; Lease payments are subject to an annual
adjustment on January 1 each year based upon the percentage change in an index
published by the Bureau of Labor Statistics of the United States Department of
Commerce.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">23</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='23',FILE='C:\JMS\eudelhofen\06-9742-1\task1193661\9742-1-ba-03.htm',USER='eudelho',CD='Jun 27 14:18 2006' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Mesaba leases approximately 38,000 square
feet of hangar office space located on approximately 102,000 square feet of
land and parking areas of which Mesaba is ground lessee at the Central
Wisconsin Airport in Mosinee, Wisconsin.&#160;
Mesaba pays approximately $3,000 per month under the terms of the ground
and facility leases, which expire on December 31, 2011, subject to two ten-year
renewal options.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Big Sky</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Big Sky&#146;s main hangar and principal offices
are located at the Logan International Airport in Billings, Montana.&#160; The main facility consists of a 12,000 square
foot building that can hold three aircraft for maintenance, a parts warehouse,
back shop area and two floors of offices.&#160;
A two-story building adjacent to the hangar houses Big Sky&#146;s general
offices.&#160; These buildings are situated on
approximately 83,000 square feet of land owned by the City of Billings and
leased to Big Sky on long-term facility and ground leases.&#160; The facility lease has a 20-year term, and
the ground lease has a 26-year term.&#160; The
combined monthly lease payment is approximately $7,000.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<h2 style="font-style:italic;margin:12.0pt 0in 3.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:normal;">Item
3.&#160; LEGAL PROCEEDINGS</font></i></b><a name="Item3_LegalProceedings_101059"></a></h2>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Mesaba
Bankruptcy</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On October 13, 2005, Mesaba filed a voluntary
petition for relief under Chapter 11 of the United States Bankruptcy Code with
the United States Bankruptcy Court for the District of Minnesota.&#160; The Bankruptcy Court is administering Mesaba&#146;s
case under the caption &#147;In re Mesaba Aviation, Inc., dba Mesaba Airlines, Case
No. 05/39258(GFK).&#148;&#160; Mesaba continues to
operate its business and manage its property as a debtor-in-possession pursuant
to the Bankruptcy Code.&#160; As a result of
the Chapter 11 filing, attempts to collect, secure or enforce remedies with
respect to prepetition claims against Mesaba are subject to the automatic stay
provisions of Section 362(a) of the Bankruptcy Code, including the Mesaba
litigation described below.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Saab
Leasing Litigation</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On October 4, 2002, Fairbrook Leasing, Inc.,
Lambert Leasing, Inc. and Swedish Aircraft Holdings AB (&#147;Saab Leasing&#148;) filed a
declaratory judgment action against Mesaba relating to 20 Saab 340A (&#147;340A&#148;)
aircraft leased by Mesaba.&#160; Saab Leasing
sought a judicial declaration that the terms of the leases applicable to each
of the 340A aircraft are governed by a March 7, 1996 term sheet proposal rather
than the parties&#146; subsequent agreements and conduct.&#160; In a December 8, 2003 order, the District
Court for the District of Minnesota (the &#147;District Court&#148;) declared the term
sheet proposal a binding preliminary agreement requiring Mesaba to negotiate in
good faith toward the execution of long-term agreements for each of the 340A
aircraft.&#160; Mesaba appealed the District
Court&#146;s ruling.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On August 13, 2004, relying on the District
Court&#146;s declaratory judgment ruling, Saab Leasing filed a separate action in
the District Court alleging approximately $35 million in damages for past due
and future aircraft lease obligations.&#160;
Mesaba denied the allegations in Saab Leasing&#146;s complaint and contended
that it had fulfilled and would continue to fulfill its existing obligations.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On May 19, 2005, the United States Court of
Appeals for the Eighth Circuit (the &#147;Court of Appeals&#148;) affirmed the District
Court&#146;s declaratory judgment ruling.&#160;
Despite the Court of Appeals&#146; ruling, Mesaba believes, based on advice
from its legal counsel, that it has defenses in the damages case that will
limit Saab Leasing&#146;s ability to recover damages.&#160; On September 9, 2005, the District Court
heard oral arguments on Saab Leasing&#146;s and Mesaba&#146;s cross-motions for summary
judgment.&#160; The District Court did not
rule on these motions prior to Mesaba&#146;s bankruptcy petition.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On October 14, 2005, Mesaba notified the
District Court that Mesaba applied for debtor protection under Chapter 11 of
the Bankruptcy Code and that such application operates to automatically stay
the </font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">24</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='24',FILE='C:\JMS\eudelhofen\06-9742-1\task1193661\9742-1-ba-03.htm',USER='eudelho',CD='Jun 27 14:18 2006' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">continuation of the Saab Leasing matter. &#160;On January 19, 2006, the Bankruptcy Court
denied Saab Leasing&#146;s motion for relief from the automatic stay and held that
Saab Leasing could not continue with the case until at least May 1, 2006.&#160; On June 16, 2006, the Bankruptcy Court
approved Mesaba&#146;s and Saab Leasing&#146;s stipulation modifying the automatic stay
for the limited purpose of permitting the District Court to rule on the
cross-motions for summary judgment.&#160;
There can be no assurance that the District Court will grant Mesaba&#146;s
motion for summary judgment.&#160; Therefore,
the ultimate outcome of this dispute cannot be predicted with certainty.&#160; Ultimately, the amount of any damages award
to Saab Leasing would be deemed an unsecured prepetition claim against
Mesaba.&#160; As of March 31, 2006, Mesaba had
not established any accrual with regard to this litigation within its condensed
financial statements (see &#147;Item 8. Financial Statements and Supplemental Data,
Note 20 &#151; Financial Information of Mesaba&#148;).</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Other
Litigation Matters</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Mesaba is also a defendant in various
lawsuits arising in the ordinary course of business.&#160; While the outcome of these lawsuits and
proceedings cannot be predicted with certainty, it is the opinion of Mesaba&#146;s
management based on current information and legal advice that the ultimate disposition
of these suits will not have a material adverse effect on the separate
financial statements of Mesaba.</font></p>

<h2 style="font-style:italic;margin:12.0pt 0in 3.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:normal;">Item
4.&#160; SUBMISSION OF MATTERS TO A VOTE OF
SECURITY HOLDERS</font></i></b><a name="Item4_SubmissionOfMattersToAVoteO_101106"></a></h2>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On March 9, 2006, the Company held its 2005
annual meeting of shareholders, at which Donald E. Benson and Carl R. Pohlad
were reelected as directors of the Company to serve until 2008.&#160; The shareholders also ratified the
appointment of Deloitte &amp; Touche LLP to serve as the Company&#146;s independent
registered public accounting firm for the fiscal year ending March 31,
2006.&#160; Mr. Benson received 18,726,131
votes for his reelection and 448,568 against his reelection.&#160; Mr. Pohlad received 19,031,640 votes for his
reelection and 143,059 votes against his reelection.&#160; There were 19,071,990 votes cast for
ratification of Deloitte &amp; Touche LLP, 87,783 votes cast against
ratification, 14,926 abstentions and no broker non-votes.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<h2 style="font-style:italic;margin:12.0pt 0in 3.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:normal;">EXECUTIVE
OFFICERS OF THE REGISTRANT</font></i></b><a name="ExecutiveOfficersOfTheRegistrant_101109"></a></h2>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in 12.0pt;text-align:left;text-indent:0in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Paul F. Foley</font></b><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">, age 54, has been the President and Chief
Executive Officer of the Holdings since October 1999 and was President and
Chief Executive Officer of Mesaba from October 1999 to September 2002.&#160; He is also a director of Holdings.&#160; He was Vice President at Atlas Air, Inc. from
December 1996 to September 1999.&#160; He
presently serves as a director of Zomax Incorporated.&#160; Mr. Foley graduated with a bachelor of
science degree from Cornell University and a master of business administration
degree from Southern Methodist University in Dallas, Texas.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in 12.0pt;text-align:left;text-indent:0in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Robert E. Weil</font></b><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">, age 41, has been Vice President, Chief
Financial Officer and Treasurer of Holdings since January 2000 and also served
as Vice President, Chief Financial Officer of Mesaba from January 2000 to
September 2002.&nbsp; Mr. Weil was the Managing Director of Finance - Ground
Operation for Northwest Airlines from December 1997 until joining
Holdings.&nbsp; He also held the position of Controller - Ground Operations and
held various other finance positions at Northwest since 1991.&#160; Mr. Weil graduated with a bachelor of arts
degree in economics from Northwestern University and a master of management
degree from J. L. Kellogg Graduate School of Management.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:0in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Ruth M. Timm</font></b><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">, age 36,
joined the Company in April 2005 as its Vice President, General Counsel.&#160; Ms. Timm was General Counsel at Integris
Metals, Inc. from October 2004 until February 2005, when the company was sold
to a competitor.&#160; Ms. Timm was an
associate in the corporate department of Leonard, Street and Deinard
Professional Association from October 2000 until September 2004, and an
associate at </font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">25</font></p>

<div align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:0in;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

</div>

<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in 12.0pt;text-align:left;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Maun &amp; Simon, PLC from September 1999 to October
2000.&#160; Ms. Timm served as a judicial law
clerk for the Honorable Paul A. Magnuson, Chief Judge, U.S. District Court for
the District of Minnesota from 1997 to 1999.&#160;
She received her law degree from Valparaiso University School of Law in
1997.</font></p>

<h1 align="center" style="margin:12.0pt 0in 3.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">PART II</font></b><a name="PartIi_101111"></a></h1>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<h2 style="font-style:italic;margin:12.0pt 0in 3.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:normal;">Item
5.&#160; MARKET FOR REGISTRANT&#146;S COMMON EQUITY
AND RELATED SHAREHOLDER MATTERS</font></i></b><a name="Item5_MarketForRegistrantsCommonE_101115"></a></h2>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company&#146;s common stock is traded under
the symbol &#147;MAIR&#148; on the Nasdaq National Market.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The following table sets forth, for the
periods indicated, the high and low price per share for the Company&#146;s common
stock for the two most recent fiscal years.&#160;
Quotations for such periods are as reported by Nasdaq for National
Market issues.&#160; The Company has not
issued cash dividends since September 1995 and does not currently intend to do
so in the future.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On June 1, 2006, the number of holders of
record of common stock was 571.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The transfer agent for the Company&#146;s common
stock is Wells Fargo Shareowner Services, 161 North Concord Exchange, South St.
Paul, Minnesota, 55075-0738, telephone:&#160;
(651) 450-4064.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The equity compensation plans approved by the
Company&#146;s shareholders are the 1994 Stock Option Plan, the 1996 Director Stock
Option Plan and the 2000 Stock Incentive Plan.&#160;
The 2000 Stock Incentive Plan contains a provision that automatically
increases the authorized shares available for grant on September 1 of each year
by the lesser of 300,000 or 1% of the then outstanding common shares.&#160; See &#147;Item 8. Financial Statements and
Supplemental Data, Note 11 &#151; Shareholders&#146; Equity&#148; for additional information
regarding the Company&#146;s equity compensation plans.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<h2 style="font-style:italic;margin:12.0pt 0in 3.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:normal;">Item
6.&#160; SELECTED FINANCIAL DATA</font></i></b><a name="Item6_SelectedFinancialData_101125"></a></h2>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The following tables set forth selected
financial data with respect to the Company as of the dates and for the periods
indicated.&#160; The selected financial data
has been derived from the Company&#146;s audited consolidated financial statements,
which have been restated to give effect to the restatement discussed in &#147;Item
8. Financial Statements and Supplemental Data, Note 16 &#151; Restatement.&#148;&#160; As of the Petition Date, the accounts of
Mesaba were deconsolidated from the Company&#146;s consolidated financial
statements.&#160; Therefore, the financial
data below excludes Mesaba from the Petition Date forward.&#160; The financial data set forth below should be
read in conjunction with the Company&#146;s Consolidated Financial Statements and
Notes thereto and &#147;Item 7. Management&#146;s Discussion and Analysis of Financial
Condition and Results of Operations.&#148;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Like other air carriers, Mesaba discloses
information regarding passengers, revenue passenger miles, available seat
miles, load factor and revenue per available seat mile in &#147;Selected Operating
Data&#148; below.&#160; While this data is often
used to assess the financial performance of a major carrier, for a regional
carrier such as Mesaba operating under a capacity purchase agreement, this data
is not directly relevant to Mesaba&#146;s revenues or profitability.&#160; However, it is provided to indicate the size
and scope of Mesaba&#146;s operations.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="10%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:10.36%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">0.267</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:2.22%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="10%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:10.36%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">0.262</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:2.22%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="10%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:10.38%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:2.2%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr>
  <td width="34%" valign="top" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:34.88%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 30.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Cost per ASM (excluding impairment and other charges) (4)</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:2.22%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="10%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:10.36%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">0.331</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:2.22%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="10%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:10.36%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">0.337</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:2.22%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="10%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:10.36%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">0.267</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:2.22%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="10%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:10.36%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">0.262</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:2.22%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="10%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:10.38%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:2.2%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="1" width="25%" noshade color="black" align="left"></div>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(1) ASM are determined by multiplying the
number of seats available for passengers by the number of miles flown.&#160; Amounts are in thousands.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(2) Revenue passenger miles are determined by
multiplying the number of fare-paying passengers carried by the distance
flown.&#160; Amounts are in thousands.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(3) Load factor is determined by dividing
revenue passenger miles by available seat miles.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">28</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='28',FILE='C:\JMS\eudelhofen\06-9742-1\task1193661\9742-1-ba-03.htm',USER='eudelho',CD='Jun 27 14:18 2006' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(4)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Revenue per ASM
and cost per ASM for fiscal 2005 and 2004 have been restated to give
effect&nbsp;to the restatement discussed in &#147;Item 8. Financial Statements and
Supplemental Data, Note 16 - Restatement.&#148;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(5)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Big Sky was
purchased by the Company in December 2002.&#160;
Operating data for fiscal 2003 is from the date of purchase to March 31,
2003.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<h2 style="font-style:italic;margin:12.0pt 0in 3.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:normal;">Item
7.&#160; MANAGEMENT&#146;S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS
OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS</font></i></b><a name="Item7_ManagementsDiscussionAndAna_101133"></a></h2>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Management&#146;s Discussion and Analysis of
Financial Condition and Results of Operations has been restated to give effect
to the restatement discussed in &#147;Item 8. Financial Statements and Supplemental
Data, Note 16 &#151; Restatement,&#148; and should be read in conjunction with the
accompanying consolidated financial statements.&#160;
The Company&#146;s operations and financial results are subject to various
risks and uncertainties as discussed in &#147;Item 1A.&#160; Risk Factors.&#148;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Year in
Review and Outlook</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Summary</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Fiscal 2006 is best summarized by reviewing
the year in two distinct periods: the time before and the time after the
Northwest bankruptcy in September 2005.&#160;
Prior to Northwest declaring bankruptcy, Mesaba was focused on adding
the CRJ to its certificate and completing the new omnibus ASA with
Northwest.&#160; The new ASA extended the Saab
and Avro agreements past 2007 to 2015 and provided for 15 new CRJ aircraft.&#160; Mesaba maintained its outstanding operating
performance throughout the summer and received FAA certification for the CRJ in
less than six months.&#160; In recognition of
its strong commitment to safety and loss prevention programs, Mesaba was
awarded the AIG Operational Excellence Award during the summer of 2005.&#160; Two CRJs entered Mesaba&#146;s fleet in the first
week of September 2005, and Mesaba began operating them in October 2005.&#160; Throughout the summer, Mesaba also
implemented a contingency plan to ensure that Northwest&#146;s mechanics&#146; strike in
August 2005 did not impact Mesaba&#146;s operations.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On September 14, 2005, Northwest filed for
bankruptcy protection under Chapter 11 of the Bankruptcy Code.&#160; Northwest missed two payments to Mesaba in
September 2005 for services between August 15 and September 14.&#160; Since its bankruptcy filing, Northwest has
also implemented various changes to Mesaba&#146;s fleet, including idling nine of
the Avros operated by Mesaba effective October 31, 2005 and three additional
Avros and 11 Saabs effective January 4, 2006.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Northwest&#146;s missed payments and its subsequent
changes to Mesaba&#146;s fleet adversely affected Mesaba and ultimately resulted in
Mesaba filing for bankruptcy protection on October 13, 2005.&#160; Following its bankruptcy filing, Mesaba&#146;s
focus moved from adding the CRJ to its fleet to implementing a bankruptcy
strategy to reduce its labor and non-labor costs and to emerge as a competitive
regional airline that will be able to provide quality regional airline
services.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Following fiscal 2006 year end, Northwest
removed two more Saabs and seven additional Avros effective June 8, 2006.&#160; Northwest has indicated its intent to remove
all of the remaining aircraft, other than 49 Saabs, from Mesaba&#146;s fleet by
December 31, 2006, subject to final lease negotiations between Northwest and
its lessors.&#160; As of June 8, 2006, Mesaba
was operating a total of 16 Avros, 50 Saabs and two CRJs.&#160; Finally, Northwest issued a request for
proposal for flying up to 126 CRJs in December 2005.&#160; Mesaba </font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">29</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='29',FILE='C:\JMS\eudelhofen\06-9742-1\task1193661\9742-1-ba-03.htm',USER='eudelho',CD='Jun 27 14:18 2006' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">has submitted a bid for additional CRJs, but
realizes that many of its competitors have also submitted bids to operate such
aircraft.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Separately, Big Sky completed its fleet
transition, bringing on ten Beechcraft 1900Ds and retiring the Metros. The
aftermath of the major hurricanes in the summer and fall of 2005 and the
resulting increase in fuel prices negatively impacted Big Sky&#146;s financial
results and led to the recording of a $2.5 million goodwill impairment charge.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Outlook</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">As the airline industry continues through its
transformation, the Company and its subsidiaries will focus its efforts in
fiscal 2007 on four main strategies:</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Mesaba</font></u></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Mesaba will
attempt to execute its bankruptcy reorganization strategy, which includes
downsizing its fleet to 49 Saabs, achieving significant cost savings, including
both labor and non-labor expenses and affirming its business relationship with
Northwest by either assuming the existing ASA or negotiating a new ASA.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Mesaba will
then attempt to develop a plan of reorganization to successfully emerge from
bankruptcy as a competitive low-cost supplier of regional flights.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Big
Sky</font></u></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 39.0pt;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Big Sky will
focus on growing its Beechcraft 1900D operation by bidding on additional EAS
flying and looking for other opportunities to expand its fleet.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Holdings</font></u></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 39.0pt;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Holdings will
explore additional growth opportunities and will consider acquisitions to
diversify both within and outside the airline industry.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Fiscal Year Ended March 31, 2006
Compared with Fiscal Year Ended March 31, 2005</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Earnings
Summary</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company reported a consolidated net loss
of $82.8 million, or $4.02 per basic and diluted share, for fiscal 2006,
compared to net income of $7.4 million, or $0.35 per diluted share, in fiscal
2005.&#160; To allow for a more direct and
meaningful comparison, Mesaba&#146;s results of operations have been analyzed for
the entire fiscal years ended March 31, 2006 and 2005 not withstanding the
deconsolidation of Mesaba from the Company&#146;s consolidated financial statements
as of October 13, 2005, the date of Mesaba&#146;s bankruptcy filing.&#160; Mesaba&#146;s condensed financial statements on a
stand-alone basis are presented in &#147;Item 8. Financial Statements and
Supplemental Data, Note 20 &#151; Financial Information of Mesaba.&#148;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Mesaba</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Mesaba
Operating Revenues</font></u></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Total operating revenues decreased 4.4% in
fiscal 2006 to $408.8 million from $427.5 million in fiscal 2005.&#160; The decrease was due primarily to a drop in
Avro revenue of $24.9 million or 12.7% as a result of 12 Avros removed from the
schedule by Northwest between October 31, 2005 and January 4, 2006.&#160; Avro block hours for fiscal 2006 were down
15.6%.&#160; Saab revenue decreased $0.9
million, or 0.4%, in fiscal 2006 compared to fiscal 2005 primarily due to a
decrease in Saab ASMs of 2.8% and an increase in the fuel offset to revenue
year over year.&#160; The decline in Saab
revenue was partially offset by an increase in rate per ASM of 4.1% and an
increase in the passenger stipend due to an increased number of passengers
flying the Saab aircraft.&#160; The decrease
in Saab and Avro revenue was offset in part by the additional </font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">30</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='30',FILE='C:\JMS\eudelhofen\06-9742-1\task1193661\9742-1-ba-03.htm',USER='eudelho',CD='Jun 27 14:18 2006' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">revenue generated by the two new CRJ aircraft
of $5.5 million and additional ground handling revenue of $1.1 million.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Mesaba
Operating Expenses</font></u></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Total operating expenses in fiscal 2006 increased
8.7% to $448.9 million from $413.1 million in fiscal 2005.&#160; The cost per ASM increased 20.7% to $0.163 in
fiscal 2006 from $0.135 in fiscal 2005.&#160;
The following table compares components of operating cost per ASM for
the years ended March 31:</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%" style="border-collapse:collapse;width:100.0%;">
 <tr>
  <td width="24%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:24.5%;">
  <p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 10.0pt;text-align:center;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:2.08%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="45%" colspan="10" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:45.96%;">

  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#162;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="9%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 1.5pt;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:9.98%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">13.5</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in .7pt 1.5pt .7pt;width:1.4%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#162;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Wages and benefits increased 3.3% to $145.5
million in fiscal 2006 from $140.9 million in fiscal 2005.&#160; The significant factors contributing to this
increase were an increase in health and dental expenses of $3.2 million,
increased personnel and other costs related to additional ground handling and
customer service of $1.8 million primarily due to increased handling in
Detroit, and an increase in pilot training of $1.4 million.&#160; These increases were partially offset by a
decrease of $0.6 million for the 401(k) benefit plan primarily due to increased
costs in the prior year for a voluntary compliance program settlement with the
Internal Revenue Service related to incorrect vesting and matching
contributions in prior years and reduced incentive compensation of $2.4
million.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Aircraft
maintenance costs, excluding wages and benefits, increased 1.8% to $83.4
million in fiscal 2006 from $81.9 million in fiscal 2005.&#160; Aircraft maintenance costs increased
primarily due to additional costs related to a rate adjustment for accruals for
aircraft checks and additional rotable repairs.&#160;
These increases were partially offset by maintenance expense reductions
driven by a 5.5% reduction in total block hours.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Aircraft rents decreased 7.5% to $92.9
million in fiscal 2006 from $100.5 million in fiscal 2005.&#160; This decrease is attributable to the 12 Avros
idled by Northwest ($7.4 million) and the 11 Saabs removed from service in
January 2006 due to certain Mesaba leases with Pinnacle being rejected ($2.0
million), partially offset by the addition of two CRJs ($1.3 million).</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Landing
fees decreased 6.3% to $9.3 million in fiscal 2006 from $10.0 million in fiscal
2005 due to reduced flying.&#160; Although
Northwest is responsible for the Avro landing fees for Mesaba&#146;s operations,
Mesaba pays several airports directly and Northwest reimburses Mesaba for such
payments.&#160; The reimbursement from
Northwest for these Avro landing fees was $2.9 million and $3.5 million in
fiscal 2006 and 2005, respectively, and is recorded as both landing fees
expense and passenger revenue in Mesaba&#146;s condensed statements of operations.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Insurance and taxes increased 3.1% from $6.2
million in fiscal 2005 to $6.3 million in fiscal 2006.&nbsp; The increase is
due to a one-time credit of $0.8 million received in fiscal 2005 for property
tax reimbursement from Northwest.&nbsp; These increases were offset by lower
hull and passenger insurance of $0.7 million due to reduced rates,
the&nbsp;smaller fleet size and reduced number of passengers.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">31</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='31',FILE='C:\JMS\eudelhofen\06-9742-1\task1193661\9742-1-ba-03.htm',USER='eudelho',CD='Jun 27 14:18 2006' -->



<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">

<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Depreciation and amortization decreased 11.6%
to $12.2 million in fiscal 2006 compared to $13.8 million in fiscal 2005.&#160; The lower level of depreciation and
amortization resulted from reduced capital spending over the last several years
and reduced fleet size.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Administrative and other expenses increased
13.6% to $68.0 million in fiscal 2006 from $59.9 million in fiscal 2005.&#160; Significant factors resulting in this
increase were an increase of $2.7 million primarily related to pilot and
mechanic training in preparation for the CRJ fleet, an increase of $2.6 million
primarily related to additional repairs by outside vendors and the contingency
plan to ensure that Northwest&#146;s mechanics&#146; strike did not impact Mesaba&#146;s
operations, an increase of $0.7 million primarily related to ground handling
and an increase of $1.0 million primarily related to the increased use of
contract employees.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Impairment
and other charges of $31.2 million were recorded in fiscal 2006 as a result of
establishing a $29.1 million reserve for the unsecured prepetition receivables
due from Northwest (net of certain offsetting liabilities) due to the September
2005 bankruptcy filing by Northwest and a $2.1 million write-off of the
remaining unamortized net book value of the warrants related to the prior
Airlink and Jet Agreements with Northwest.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Mesaba
incurred fuel expenditures of $19.2 million, or 0.7 cents per ASM, in fiscal
2006 compared to $16.9 million, or 0.6 cents per ASM, in fiscal 2005. </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#160;</font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In accordance
with EITF Issue No. 99-19, <i><font style="font-style:italic;">Reporting Revenue Gross as
a Principal vs. Net as an Agent</font></i>, these costs are classified as a
reduction from revenue in Mesaba&#146;s condensed statements of operations.&#160; Mesaba&#146;s actual cost of fuel for the Saab
aircraft, including taxes and pumping fees, was 83.5 cents per gallon.&#160; Mesaba&#146;s actual cost of fuel for the CRJs,
including taxes and pumping fees, was 70 cents per gallon.&#160; These prices are fixed under the terms of the
ASA, thereby insulating Mesaba from fluctuations in the market price of fuel.&#160; Northwest is responsible for all fuel for
Mesaba&#146;s Avro operations.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Big Sky</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Big
Sky Operating Revenues</font></u></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Total
operating revenues increased 35.1% to $20.4 million in fiscal 2006 from $15.1
million in fiscal 2005.&#160; New fiscal 2006
service </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">between</font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;"> Sheridan, Wyoming and Denver, Colorado, Bozeman,
Montana, Pocatello, Idaho, Walla Walla, Washington and Boise, Idaho contributed
to the 27.1% increase in flying.&#160; The
system experienced an increase of 4.9 load factor points and a 17.6% increase
in average fare in fiscal 2006 compared to fiscal 2005.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Other revenues increased 14.8% as a result of
a new EAS subsidy contract for service between Sheridan, Wyoming and Denver,
Colorado and an improvement in flight completion of 2.5 points.&#160;&#160; Fiscal 2006 includes ground handling revenue
and a short-term wet lease operation provided by Big Sky generating $0.3
million.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">32</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='32',FILE='C:\JMS\eudelhofen\06-9742-1\task1193661\9742-1-ba-05.htm',USER='eudelho',CD='Jun 27 14:19 2006' -->

  <p align="right" style="color:black;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">2,355</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:2.1%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="9%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:9.94%;">
