<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The information in the table above is based
on Mesaba&#146;s current assessment of its future fleet composition.&#160; Accordingly, the lease agreements for 23
Avros that had scheduled future minimum rental payments of $40.6 million per
year through fiscal 2016 are not included in the above table (other than $14.6
million in fiscal 2007) as these remaining 23 Avros will be removed by December
31, 2006.&#160; The table above also excludes
amounts associated with the 12 Avros idled and removed from the fleet by
Northwest during fiscal 2006.&#160; If
Northwest&#146;s fleet decisions change in the future, Mesaba&#146;s future minimum
rental payments will change accordingly.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Mesaba&#146;s rent expense for aircraft operating
leases was $93.0 million, $100.5 million and $103.0 million in fiscal 2006,
2005 and 2004, respectively (including $73.9 million, $59.5 million and $66.0
million paid to Northwest in fiscal 2006, 2005 and 2004, respectively).&#160; See Note 20.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">69</font></p>

<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Big
Sky</font></u></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Big Sky&#146;s airline fleet consisted of the
following aircraft held under operating leases as of March 31, 2006:</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%" style="border-collapse:collapse;width:100.02%;">
 <tr>
  <td width="26%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:26.38%;">
  <p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 10.0pt;text-align:center;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:2.4%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="15%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:15.44%;">
  <p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>

  </td>
  <td width="15%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:15.44%;">
  <p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:2.4%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="15%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:15.44%;">
  <p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Approximate</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:2.4%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="15%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:15.44%;">

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Big Sky&#146;s fleet consisted of 14 aircraft
covered under operating leases with remaining terms of 17 to 56 months and
aggregate monthly lease payments of approximately $0.2 million.&#160; Big Sky leases its aircraft from leasing
companies and from Mesa Airlines, Inc.&#160;
As of March 31, 2006 Big Sky had accrued $0.8 million to estimate the lease
and return expenses of the four nonoperating Metro III aircraft.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Big
Sky&#146;s aircraft operating leases do not contain any guaranteed lease residual
provisions for which there would be a potential contingency at the termination
of the lease period.&#160; As of March 31,
2006, the aircraft operating leases for Big Sky require future minimum rental
payments as follows, in thousands:</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

  </td>
  <td width="5%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:5.2%;">

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Consolidated rent expense for aircraft
operating leases, excluding Mesaba after its deconsolidation on October 13,
2005, was $56.3 million, $102.5 million and $105.5 million in fiscal 2006, 2005
and 2004, respectively.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">70</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Non-Aircraft

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The
Company leases land, offices, hangar facilities, equipment and certain terminal
facilities under operating leases through 2019, which provide for approximate
future minimum rental payments as follows as of March 31, in thousands:</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company&#146;s consolidated rent expense for
non-aircraft operating leases was approximately $1.1 million, $15.4 million and
$16.2 million in fiscal 2006, 2005 and 2004, respectively.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Separately, as described in Note 14, Holdings
has guaranteed Mesaba&#146;s obligations with respect to Mesaba&#146;s facility at the
Cincinnati/Northern Kentucky International Airport.&#160; Since Mesaba&#146;s bankruptcy filing, Holdings
has made the payments owed by Mesaba under the ground lease and facilities
lease, which payments total approximately $1.2 million annually.&#160; These guaranty payments are reflected in the
table above.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Mesaba
leases land, offices, hangar facilities, equipment and certain terminal
facilities under operating leases through 2028, which provide for approximate
future minimum rental payments as follows as of March 31, in thousands:</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

  </td>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Mesaba&#146;s expense for non-aircraft operating
leases was approximately $12.6 million, $14.7 million and $15.9 million in
fiscal 2006, 2005 and 2004, respectively (see Note 20).</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">71</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

and the present value of future minimum capital lease payments as of March 31,
were as follows, in thousands:</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The carrying value of the facility under
capital lease net of accumulated depreciation was $0.5 million at both March
31, 2006 and 2005.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-.25in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">9.</font></b><b><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font></b><b><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Notes
Payable and Long-Term Debt</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Long-term
debt is recorded in other noncurrent liabilities in the consolidated balance
sheet and consists of the following as of March 31, in thousands:</font></p>

 </tr>
 <tr>
  <td width="81%" valign="top" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:81.46%;">

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">72</font></p>

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='72',FILE='C:\JMS\ethompsb\06-9742-1\task1193038\9742-1-ba-11.htm',USER='ethompsb',CD='Jun 27 10:25 2006' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Line of
Credit</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In
February 2005, Big Sky obtained a revolving line of credit in the principal
amount of $250,000 from First Interstate Bank of Billings.&#160; In March 2006, the principal amount available
under the line increased to $370,000.&#160;
The line of credit charges a variable interest rate based on the prime
rate published in the <i><font style="font-style:italic;">Wall Street Journal</font></i>.&#160; At March 31, 2006, the rate was 7.75%.&#160; The line of credit is collateralized by Big
Sky&#146;s inventory, accounts receivable and equipment and is scheduled to mature
in January 2007.&#160; The balance of the line
of credit was $0.4 million and $0.1 million as of March 31, 2006 and 2005,
respectively.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-.25in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">10.</font></b><b><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font></b><b><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Income Taxes</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The
Company&#146;s consolidated provision (benefit) for income taxes, excluding Mesaba
after its deconsolidation on October 13, 2005, was comprised of the following elements
for the years ended March 31, in thousands:</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

  </td>

  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>

  <td width="67%" valign="top" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:67.92%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:2.92%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 1.5pt;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:1.5%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="9%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;border-bottom:double windowtext 1.5pt;border-left:none;border-right:none;border-top:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:9.52%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#151;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:2.94%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 1.5pt;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:1.5%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="10%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;border-bottom:double windowtext 1.5pt;border-left:none;border-right:none;border-top:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:10.84%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">14,126</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:2.86%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Consolidated</font></u></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">SFAS No. 109, <i><font style="font-style:italic;">Accounting
for Income Taxes</font></i>, requires that all available evidence, both
positive and negative, be considered to determine whether, based on the weight
of that evidence, a valuation allowance is needed.&#160; Future realization of the tax benefits of an
existing deductible temporary difference or carryforward ultimately depends on
the existence of sufficient taxable income of the appropriate character within
the carryback or carryforward periods available under the tax law.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company has performed such an analysis,
and a valuation allowance has been provided against deferred tax assets to the
extent they cannot be used to offset future income arising from the expected
reversal of taxable differences.&#160; A
valuation allowance of $3.6 million has been provided due to the significance
of the Company&#146;s losses and significant uncertainties of its ability to realize
these assets.&#160; The Company will be
required to update its estimates of future taxable income based upon additional
information management obtains, and the Company will continue to evaluate the
realizability of the deferred tax assets on a quarterly basis.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Deferred income taxes reflect the net tax
effects of temporary differences between the carrying amounts of assets and
liabilities for financial reporting purposes and the amounts used for income
tax purposes.&#160; At March 31, 2006, the
Company&#146;s federal deferred tax assets included $7.1 million of net operating
loss (&#147;NOL&#148;) carryforwards (excluding Mesaba&#146;s NOL carryforwards discussed
below).&#160; Of these NOL carryforwards,
$3.7&nbsp;million are federal NOLs related to Big Sky and are subject to
Section 382 of the Internal Revenue Code, which restricts the annual
utilization of certain NOLs incurred prior to a change </font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">74</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='74',FILE='C:\JMS\ethompsb\06-9742-1\task1193038\9742-1-ba-11.htm',USER='ethompsb',CD='Jun 27 10:25 2006' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">in ownership.&#160;
These Big Sky NOL carryforwards expire through 2022.&#160; The remaining balance is made up of $3.4
million in federal NOLs, which expire in 2026, and $10.5 million in state NOLs,
which expire over the next five to twenty years.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">During the first quarter of fiscal 2005, the
Company received verification of a final settlement with the Internal Revenue
Service (&#147;IRS&#148;) concerning the IRS&#146; examination of the Company&#146;s fiscal 1995
and 1996 income tax returns.&#160; As a result
of this settlement, the Company reduced its income tax payable and tax
provision by $1.2 million in the first quarter of fiscal 2005.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">As a result of the deconsolidation of Mesaba
in the third quarter of fiscal 2006, all of Mesaba&#146;s net deferred tax assets
are no longer presented in the accompanying consolidated balance sheet at March
31, 2006 but remain a part of Mesaba&#146;s condensed financial statements at March
31, 2006 (see Note 20).&#160; Holdings still
owns 100% of Mesaba, and Holdings will continue to include Mesaba in its
consolidated tax return filings as long as Holdings owns at least 80% of
Mesaba.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Mesaba</font></u></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Mesaba&#146;s provision (benefit) for income taxes
was comprised of the following elements for the years ended March 31, in
thousands:</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

thousands:</font></p>

classified as follows as of March 31, in thousands:</font></p>

  <p align="right" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">1,308</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="3%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt .7pt;width:3.24%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr>
  <td width="54%" valign="top" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt .7pt;width:54.66%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 10.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="3%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt .7pt;width:3.32%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 1.5pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt .7pt;width:1.88%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="15%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;border-bottom:double windowtext 1.5pt;border-left:none;border-right:none;border-top:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt .7pt;width:15.58%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#151;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="3%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt .7pt;width:3.32%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 1.5pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt .7pt;width:1.88%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 1.5pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt .7pt;width:16.12%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">12,371</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="3%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt .7pt;width:3.24%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">SFAS No. 109 requires that all available
evidence, both positive and negative, be considered to determine whether, based
on the weight of that evidence, a valuation allowance is needed.&#160; Future realization of the tax benefits of an
existing deductible temporary difference or carryforward ultimately depends on
the existence of sufficient taxable income of the appropriate character within
the carryback or carryforward periods available under the tax law.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Deferred income taxes reflect the net tax
effects of temporary differences between the carrying amounts of assets and
liabilities for financial reporting purposes and the amounts used for income
tax purposes.&#160; At March 31, 2006, Mesaba&#146;s
deferred tax assets included $4.9 million of federal NOLs which expire in 2026
and $15.0 million of state NOL carryforwards which expire over the next five to
twenty years.&#160; The NOL carryforwards available
are subject to limitations on their annual usage.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Due to Mesaba&#146;s losses resulting from
creditors&#146; bankruptcy claims during the fourth quarter of fiscal 2006,
reductions in its fleet and the future income projections of a downsized
operation, management determined that the realization of all deferred tax
assets from future profitable operations was not more likely than not as of
March 31, 2006.&#160; Under these
circumstances, deferred tax assets may only be recognized to the extent such
benefits may be realized through future reversals of taxable temporary
differences.&#160; Mesaba has performed such
an analysis, and a valuation allowance has been provided against deferred tax
assets to the extent they cannot be used to offset future income arising from
the expected reversal of taxable differences.&#160;
A valuation allowance in the amount of $27.7 million has been </font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">76</font></p>

<div style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='76',FILE='C:\JMS\ethompsb\06-9742-1\task1193792\9742-1-ba-13.htm',USER='ethompsb',CD='Jun 27 14:42 2006' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p align="center" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">provided to reduce the gross amount of these
assets to the extent necessary to result in an amount that is more likely than
not of being realized.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Further, Section 382 of the Internal Revenue
Code provides that certain transfers of Mesaba&#146;s equity, or issuances of equity
in connection with its restructuring, may impair Mesaba&#146;s ability to utilize
its NOL carryforwards in the future.&#160;
Under federal income tax law, a corporation is generally permitted to
deduct from taxable income in any year NOLs carried forward from prior years.&#160; As mentioned above, Mesaba has NOL
carryforwards which expire at various times over the next twenty years. Mesaba&#146;s
ability to deduct NOL carryforwards could be subject to a significant
limitation if Mesaba undergoes an ownership change during or as a result of its
Chapter 11 proceedings.&#160; Mesaba can
provide no assurance that its bankruptcy reorganization will not result in an
ownership change that may limit its ability to utilize its NOL
carryforwards.&#160; Due to Mesaba&#146;s inability
under generally accepted accounting principles to assume future profits and its
reduced ability to implement tax planning strategies to utilize its NOLs while
in bankruptcy, Mesaba concluded that a valuation allowance was required.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 18.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">11.</font></b><b><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font></b><b><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Shareholders&#146; Equity</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Capital
Stock</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company&#146;s authorized capital stock
consists of 60,000,000 shares of common stock, par value $0.01 per share, and
1,000,000 shares of undesignated preferred stock, having no specified par
value.&#160; As of March 31, 2006, there were
20,591,840 shares of common stock issued and outstanding.&#160; No shares of preferred stock have been issued.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Holders of common stock are entitled to one
vote per share on any matter presented to shareholders for approval.&#160; The common stock has no special voting rights
or dividend preferences.&#160; Holders of
common stock are not allowed cumulative voting and do not possess any
preemptive rights to acquire any new or additional shares of stock of the
Company.&#160; Dividends are paid if and when
declared by the Company&#146;s board of directors.&#160;
In the event of a liquidation of the Company, holders of common stock
would be entitled to a pro rata distribution of any proceeds remaining after
payment to all of the Company&#146;s creditors.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company&#146;s board of directors has the
authority to designate one or more series of preferred stock, and to fix the
designations, powers, preferences, rights, qualifications, limitations and
restrictions of such series.&#160; If so
designated by the board of directors, the shares of any series of preferred
stock could be senior to the common stock with respect to distributions.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Stock
Option Plans</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company has approved stock option plans
for key employees, directors, consultants and advisors to the Company.&#160; Options have been granted and are presently
outstanding under the Company&#146;s 1994 Stock Option Plan, 1996 Director Stock
Option Plan and 2000 Stock Incentive Plan.&#160;
The 2000 Stock Incentive Plan has a provision that automatically
increases the authorized shares available for grant on September 1 of each year
by the lesser of 300,000 or 1% of the then outstanding common shares.&#160; Under the plans, the compensation committee
of the board of directors grants the options with vesting and exercise period
being determined at the time of the award.&#160;
The purchase price of the stock for non-qualified and incentive stock
options is determined at the time of the award and is generally equal to the
fair market value at the time of the award.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">77</font></p>

<div style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

</div>

31 were as follows:</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">As of March 31, 2006, there were 1,327,965
shares available for grant under the Company&#146;s 2000 Stock Incentive Plan.&#160; No shares are available&nbsp;for future
grants under either the 1994 Stock Option Plan or the 1996 Director
Stock&nbsp;Option Plan.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In December 2002, the Company repriced stock
options to purchase 745,000 shares of the Company&#146;s common stock with exercise
prices ranging from $9.05 to $18.00 to an exercise price of $5.97, which
represented the fair market value on the date of the repricing.&#160; In accordance with FASB Interpretation No.
44, <i><font style="font-style:italic;">Accounting for Certain Transactions Involving Stock
Compensation</font></i>, the Company has adopted variable plan accounting for
these options from the date of the repricing.&#160;
In fiscal 2006, the Company recorded a reduction to compensation expense
of $1.4 million.&#160; In fiscal 2005, the
Company had an immaterial reduction to compensation expense related to the
repriced options.&#160; In fiscal 2004, the
Company recorded compensation expense of $2.0 million as a result of the
repricing.&#160; As of March 31, 2006, there
remained outstanding repriced stock options exercisable for an aggregate of
404,782 shares of common stock.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 18.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">12.</font></b><b><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font></b><b><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Earnings Per Share</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Basic earnings per common share is computed
by dividing net income by the weighted average number of shares of common stock
outstanding during the year.&#160; Diluted
earnings per share is computed by dividing net income by the sum of the
weighted average number of shares of common stock outstanding plus all </font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">78</font></p>

<div style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='78',FILE='C:\JMS\ethompsb\06-9742-1\task1193792\9742-1-ba-13.htm',USER='ethompsb',CD='Jun 27 14:42 2006' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div>

<p align="center" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">additional common stock that would have been
outstanding if potentially dilutive common shares related to stock options and
warrants had been exercised.&#160; Stock
options and warrants with an exercise price exceeding the fair market value of
the Company&#146;s common stock at year-end are considered antidilutive and are
excluded from the calculation.&#160; The
following table reconciles the number of shares utilized in the earnings per
share calculations for the years ended March 31, in thousands, except per share
data:</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='79',FILE='C:\JMS\ethompsb\06-9742-1\task1193792\9742-1-ba-13.htm',USER='ethompsb',CD='Jun 27 14:42 2006' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p align="center" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 18.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">13.</font></b><b><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font></b><b><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Segment Information</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The
Company follows the provisions of SFAS No. 131, <i><font style="font-style:italic;">Disclosures
about Segments of an Enterprise and Related Information</font></i>.&#160; SFAS No. 131 establishes annual and interim
reporting standards for an enterprise&#146;s business segments and related
disclosures about its products, services, geographic areas and major
customers.&#160; The method for determining
what information to report is based upon the way management organizes the
operating segments within the Company for making operating decisions and
assessing financial performance.&#160;
Although Mesaba has been deconsolidated from the Company&#146;s condensed
consolidated financial statements as of the Petition Date, the segment
information presented below continues to include Mesaba in accordance with SFAS
No. 131 and related guidance for equity-method investees.&#160; Mesaba&#146;s results of operations after the
Petition Date are included in the &#147;Eliminations&#148; column.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Operating
segment information for Mesaba, Big Sky and Holdings were as follows, in
thousands:</font></p>

  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">)</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="10%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt .7pt;width:10.0%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(516</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt .7pt;width:2.16%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">)</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="10%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt .7pt;width:10.0%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#151;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt .7pt;width:2.16%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="10%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt .7pt;width:10.12%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">8,459</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt .7pt;width:2.16%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr>
  <td width="36%" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt .7pt;width:36.92%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 40.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Capital expenditures</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt .7pt;width:2.16%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="10%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt .7pt;width:10.0%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">10,661</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt .7pt;width:2.16%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="10%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt .7pt;width:10.0%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">25</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt .7pt;width:2.16%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="10%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt .7pt;width:10.0%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">31</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt .7pt;width:2.16%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="10%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt .7pt;width:10.0%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#151;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt .7pt;width:2.16%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="10%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt .7pt;width:10.12%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">10,717</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt .7pt;width:2.16%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

</table>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">80</font></p>

<div style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='80',FILE='C:\JMS\ethompsb\06-9742-1\task1193792\9742-1-ba-13.htm',USER='ethompsb',CD='Jun 27 14:42 2006' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p align="center" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 18.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">14.</font></b><b><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font></b><b><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Commitments and Contingencies</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Workforce</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Approximately 40% of Mesaba&#146;s workforce are
members of unions representing pilots, mechanics, dispatchers and flight
attendants.&#160; As a part of its bankruptcy
proceedings, Mesaba sought approval from the Bankruptcy Court to reject the
existing collective bargaining agreements (&#147;CBAs&#148;) with all four unions and
impose new contract terms on each labor union.&#160;
On January 31, 2006, the Bankruptcy Court approved Mesaba&#146;s tentative
agreement reached with the TWU, the union for Mesaba&#146;s dispatchers.&#160; In February and March 2006, the Bankruptcy
Court heard testimony from Mesaba and the remaining three unions for Mesaba&#146;s
pilots, mechanics and flight attendants.&#160;
On May 18, 2006, the Bankruptcy Court denied Mesaba&#146;s motion to reject.&#160; Although the Bankruptcy Court agreed with
Mesaba&#146;s core economic arguments, the court ruled that Mesaba failed to satisfy
certain technical elements required to authorize rejection of the labor
contracts.&#160; The Bankruptcy Court stated
that if Mesaba chooses to remedy the defects in its original motion, the court
would hear a renewed motion in a prompt manner.&#160;
On June 12, 2006, Mesaba filed a renewed motion for authority to reject
its CBAs, and the Bankruptcy Court began hearing the motion on June 26, 2006.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Approximately 43% of Big Sky&#146;s workforce are
members of unions representing pilots, mechanics and dispatchers.&#160; The CBAs for the pilots, mechanics and
dispatchers become amendable December 2009, August 2010 and December 2009,
respectively.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Benefit
Plan</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Mesaba maintains a 401(k) benefit plan for
eligible employees of Holdings and Mesaba whereby Holdings or Mesaba will match
25% to 125% of employee contributions to the plan, up to 10% of each employee&#146;s
eligible earnings, depending on the employee&#146;s length of service.&#160; Holdings&#146; expense related to the plan was
insignificant in fiscal 2006.&#160; Mesaba&#146;s
expense related to the plan totaled $3.3 million in fiscal 2006.&#160; The Company&#146;s expense related to the plan was
$3.9 million and $2.0 million in fiscal 2005 and 2004, respectively.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Big Sky maintains a 401(k) benefit plan
covering substantially all of its employees whereby Big Sky will match 30% of
employee contributions to the plan, up to 5% of each employee&#146;s eligible
earnings.&#160; Big Sky&#146;s contribution to the
plan was not significant in fiscal 2006, 2005 or 2004.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Stock
Appreciation Rights Plan</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">During fiscal 2004, Mesaba approved a stock
appreciation rights (&#147;SAR&#148;) plan for key employees and directors.&#160; The exercise price of each SAR is generally
equal to the fair market value of the Company&#146;s common stock on the date of the
award.&#160; Cash is paid based on the
difference between the fair market value at the date of grant and the date the
SAR is exercised.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">During fiscal 2006, no SARs were issued.&#160; During fiscal 2005, 365,000 SARs were issued
at a weighted average exercise price of $7.89 per SAR with four year vesting
and expiration in ten years.&#160; During
fiscal 2006, 322,500 SARs were cancelled due to employee terminations and
27,500 were exercised.&#160; During fiscal
2005, 50,000 SARs were cancelled due to employee terminations and none were
exercised.&#160; Compensation expense of $0.1
million was recognized in fiscal 2005, and no compensation expense was
recognized in fiscal 2006.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Regulatory
Matters</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Mesaba and Big Sky are parties to ongoing FAA
proceedings arising in the ordinary course of business.&#160; In the opinion of management, the resolution
of these matters will not have a material adverse effect on the Company&#146;s
consolidated financial position, results of operations or cash flows.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">81</font></p>

<div style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='81',FILE='C:\JMS\ethompsb\06-9742-1\task1193792\9742-1-ba-13.htm',USER='ethompsb',CD='Jun 27 14:42 2006' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div>

<p align="center" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Litigation</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company is a party to ongoing legal and
tax proceedings arising in the ordinary course of business.&#160; In the opinion of management, the resolution
of these matters will not have a material adverse effect on the Company&#146;s
consolidated financial position, results of operations or cash flows.&#160; See Note 3 for a discussion of Mesaba&#146;s
bankruptcy proceedings.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Saab
Leasing Litigation</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On October 4, 2002, Fairbrook Leasing, Inc.,
Lambert Leasing, Inc. and Swedish Aircraft Holdings AB (&#147;Saab Leasing&#148;) filed a
declaratory judgment action against Mesaba relating to 20 Saab 340A (&#147;340A&#148;)
aircraft leased by Mesaba.&#160; Saab Leasing
sought a judicial declaration that the terms of the leases applicable to each
of the 340A aircraft are governed by a March 7, 1996 term sheet proposal rather
than the parties&#146; subsequent agreements and conduct.&#160; In a December 8, 2003 order, the District
Court for the District of Minnesota (the &#147;District Court&#148;) declared the term
sheet proposal a binding preliminary agreement requiring Mesaba to negotiate in
good faith toward the execution of long-term agreements for each of the 340A
aircraft.&#160; Mesaba appealed the District
Court&#146;s ruling.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On August 13, 2004, relying on the District
Court&#146;s declaratory judgment ruling, Saab Leasing filed a separate action in
the District Court alleging approximately $35 million in damages for past due
and future aircraft lease obligations.&#160;
Mesaba denied the allegations in Saab Leasing&#146;s complaint and contended
that it had fulfilled and would continue to fulfill its existing obligations.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On May 19, 2005, the United States Court of
Appeals for the Eighth Circuit (the &#147;Court of Appeals&#148;) affirmed the District
Court&#146;s declaratory judgment ruling.&#160;
Despite the Court of Appeals&#146; ruling, Mesaba believes, based on advice
from its legal counsel, that it has defenses in the damages case that will
limit Saab Leasing&#146;s ability to recover damages.&#160; On September 9, 2005, the District Court
heard oral arguments on Saab Leasing&#146;s and Mesaba&#146;s cross-motions for summary
judgment.&#160; The District Court did not
rule on these motions prior to Mesaba&#146;s bankruptcy petition.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On October 14, 2005, Mesaba notified the
District Court that Mesaba applied for debtor protection under Chapter 11 of
the Bankruptcy Code and that such application operates to automatically stay
the continuation of the Saab Leasing matter.&#160;
On January 19, 2006, the Bankruptcy Court denied Saab Leasing&#146;s motion
for relief from the automatic stay and held that Saab Leasing could not
continue with the case until at least May 1, 2006.&#160; On June 16, 2006, the Bankruptcy Court
approved Mesaba&#146;s and Saab Leasing&#146;s stipulation modifying the automatic stay
for the limited purpose of permitting the District Court to rule on the
cross-motions for summary judgment.&#160;
There can be no assurance that the District Court will grant Mesaba&#146;s
motion for summary judgment.&#160; Therefore,
the ultimate outcome of this dispute cannot be predicted with certainty.&#160; Ultimately, the amount of any damages award
to Saab Leasing would be deemed an unsecured prepetition claim against
Mesaba.&#160; As of March 31, 2006, Mesaba had
not established any accrual with regard to this litigation within its condensed
financial statements (see &#147;Item 8. Financial Statements and Supplemental Data,
Note 20 &#151; Financial Information of Mesaba&#148;).</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Other
Litigation Matters</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Mesaba is also a defendant in various
lawsuits arising in the ordinary course of business.&#160; While the outcome of these lawsuits and
proceedings cannot be predicted with certainty, it is the opinion of Mesaba&#146;s
management based on current information and legal advice that the ultimate
disposition of these suits will not have a material adverse effect on the
separate financial statements of Mesaba.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Guaranty</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Mesaba currently leases a hangar facility at
the Cincinnati/Northern Kentucky International Airport.&#160; Holdings has unconditionally guaranteed full
and prompt payment of the bonds associated with the initial financing of the
facility.&#160; In October 2005, following its
bankruptcy filing, Mesaba vacated the facility </font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">82</font></p>

<div style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='82',FILE='C:\JMS\ethompsb\06-9742-1\task1193792\9742-1-ba-13.htm',USER='ethompsb',CD='Jun 27 14:42 2006' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p align="center" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">due to the reduced number of Avros that will
require maintenance in the future.&#160; In
accordance with its guaranty, Holdings has been making the monthly ground and
facilities lease payments of $0.1 million per month since November 2005.&#160; Additionally, on February 15, 2006, Holdings
received notice that the trustee for the bondholders declared Holdings&#146;
liability for all sums to be immediately due and payable.&#160; On April 18, 2006, Holdings entered into an
agreement with UMB, the trustee for the bondholders, under which UMB agreed to
forbear acceleration of Holdings&#146; guarantee obligations in exchange for
Holdings delivering a letter of credit in the amount of $13.1 million to secure
the payment of the obligations owed by Holdings to UMB (see Note 19).</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Because Mesaba vacated the hangar in October
2005 and Holdings is the guarantor of the facility, Holdings is currently
seeking other sublessors to lease the facility.&#160;
As of March 31, 2006, Holdings established a $4.8 million accrual
related to this guaranty, which assumes that the facility will remain vacant
for the next two years, during which time Holdings will continue to make bond
and lease payments, and that thereafter Holdings will be able to sublease the
facility at a 20% discount.&#160; Holdings
continues to search for sublessors of the facility and will reassess this
reserve in future periods as material developments occur.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Other
Guarantees</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Mesaba has letters of credit to guarantee
certain obligations principally for workers&#146; compensation policies, airport
leases and other obligations, which totaled $4.1 million and $3.4 million as of
March 31, 2006 and 2005, respectively.&#160;
There were no amounts drawn on these letters of credit during fiscal
2006, 2005 or 2004.&#160; As collateral for
these letters of credit, Mesaba had $4.5 million and $3.6 million in cash held
in an investment account as of March 31, 2006 and 2005, respectively.&#160; This amount is restricted and has been
classified within &#147;Long-term investments&#148; in Mesaba&#146;s condensed balance sheets.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In
February 2005, Big Sky obtained a revolving line of credit in the principal
amount of $250,000 from First Interstate Bank of Billings.&#160; In March 2006, the principal amount available
under the line increased to $370,000.&#160;
The line of credit charges a variable interest rate based on the prime
rate published in the <i><font style="font-style:italic;">Wall Street Journal</font></i>.&#160; At March 31, 2006, the rate was 7.75%.&#160; The line of credit is collateralized by Big
Sky&#146;s inventory, accounts receivable and equipment and is scheduled to mature
in January 2007.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 18.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">15.</font></b><b><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font></b><b><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Nonoperating Gain</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In April 2003, Congress enacted the Emergency
Wartime Supplemental Appropriations Act.&#160;
Among other items, the legislation included a $2.3 billion government
grant to United States airlines.&#160; In
accordance with this Act, for the fiscal year ended March 31, 2004, Mesaba
recognized $2.3 million as &#147;Other nonoperating income&#148; and Big Sky recognized
$0.3 million as &#147;Other nonoperating income&#148; and $0.2 million as a reduction of &#147;Administrative
and other expense&#148; in the accompanying consolidated statements of operations.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 18.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">16.</font></b><b><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font></b><b><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Restatement</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Subsequent to the issuance of its
consolidated financial statements for the year ended March 31, 2005 and the
quarter ended June 30, 2005, the Company&#146;s management determined that two
categories of pass-through costs under the ASA with Northwest were not
presented in accordance with Emerging Issues Task Force (&#147;EITF&#148;) No. 99-19, <i><font style="font-style:italic;">Reporting Revenue Gross as a Principal vs. Net as an Agent</font></i>,
and EITF No. 01-14, <i><font style="font-style:italic;">Income Statement
Characterization of Reimbursements Received for &#145;Out-of-Pocket&#146; Expenses
Incurred</font></i>.&#160; First, the Company
determined that certain landing fees reimbursed by Northwest had not been
recognized in the Company&#146;s consolidated statements of operations but should
have been recorded as both operating revenue and operating expense in prior
periods.&#160; Second, the Company determined
that aircraft fuel purchased from Northwest for the Saabs and CRJs should have
been shown as a reduction of </font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">83</font></p>

<div style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='83',FILE='C:\JMS\ethompsb\06-9742-1\task1193792\9742-1-ba-13.htm',USER='ethompsb',CD='Jun 27 14:42 2006' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p align="center" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">revenue rather than as an operating expense
in prior periods.&#160; As a result of these
misstatements, passenger revenues, aircraft fuel expense and landing fees
expense for fiscal 2005 and 2004 have been restated from amounts previously
reported.&#160; The restatement had no effect
on previously reported operating income, income before income taxes, net
income, earnings per share, net cash flows or the Company&#146;s financial
condition.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">A
summary of the significant effects of this restatement on the Company&#146;s
consolidated statements of operations for fiscal 2005 and 2004 is as follows,
in thousands:</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt .7pt;width:2.82%;">

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 18.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">17.</font></b><b><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font></b><b><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Valuation and Qualifying Account</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The following is the activity within the
Company&#146;s consolidated valuation and qualifying account for fiscal 2006, 2005
and 2004, in thousands:</font></p>

deconsolidation of Mesaba (see Note 1).</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 18.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">18.</font></b><b><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font></b><b><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Quarterly Financial Data
(Unaudited)</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

the fiscal year ended March 31, 2006, in thousands, except per share data:</font></p>

<div style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><hr size="1" width="25%" noshade color="black" align="left"></div>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(1) As discussed in Note 1, Holdings
deconsolidated Mesaba&#146;s financial results under the equity method of accounting
effective October 13, 2005, the date of Mesaba&#146;s bankruptcy filing.&#160; As a result, Mesaba&#146;s results of operations
have been removed from the Company&#146;s consolidated results of operations since
October 13, 2005.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(2) The sum of the earnings (loss) per share
for each of the individual quarters does not equal earnings per share for the
fiscal year due to rounding.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">85</font></p>

<div style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

</div>

  <p align="right" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt .7pt;width:1.16%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="7%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt .7pt;width:7.44%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt .7pt;width:1.16%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="6%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt .7pt;width:6.86%;">

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:7.0pt;">* The sum of the earnings (loss) per share for
each of the individual quarters does not equal earnings per share for the
fiscal year due to rounding.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
